title: Rao Bakhat Singh of Bedla discussing documents with four British Officials
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00240

  Image: 

  object_work_type: paintings (visual works)

  title_text: Rao Bakhat Singh of Bedla discussing documents with four British Officials

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: 1838

  creation_place_original_location: Udaipur (India : District)

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Mughal

  materials_name: paper (fiber product) gilt paint ink pigment

  techniques_name: painting (image making)

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This painting depicts the Rao Bakhat Singh of Bedla in discussion with four  British officials. The five men are sitting in decorated European-style chairs around a table. Documents are laid out on the table in their cases
 along with quill pens and ink pots. The Rao is seated on the extreme left
 with a servant assisting behind him. There are inscriptions by each figure in the painting. The painting is within decorative borders on a dark brown page.

  subject_terms_1: colonization discussions (meetings) depictions (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Meetings Colonial administrators Colonization Udaipur (Princely State) History Public officers Paintings

  subject_terms_3: Painting Colonial administrators Government officials Politics and government
